intro: Tristellateia australasiae, commonly known as the Australian starfish flower, is a unique and striking plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its intricate, star-like inflorescence. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a central disc of smaller florets, creating a visually appealing pattern. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions. Tristellateia australasiae is not only ornamental but also plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
